channel.title: Serialize on daschl writes. sometimes.

item.title: Benchmarking Cache Transcoders in PHP
item.description: Motivation Storing PHP objects (or simpler data types like arrays) in caches always requires some kind of transformation. You need a way of encoding/decoding data so that it can be stored and loaded properly. In most languages, this process is known as object serialization. PHP provides a mechanism for this out of the box, but in this article we’ll also look at igbinary as a drop-in replacement for the default serializer.
